column1: Traveling 20-27 March with two, two yo kids on a family vacation .Booked Airtickets as well as hotel but now scared given Kids are vulnerable and we will be visiting all public places with high rate of spread of infection . Please comment on how to approach this.

-:- Message from Tripadvisor staff -:-Tripadvisor staff removed this post at the original author's request.To review the Tripadvisor Forums Posting Guidelines, please follow this link: http://www.tripadvisor.com/pages/forums_posting_guidelines.htmlWe remove posts that do not follow our posting guidelines, and we reserve the right to remove any post for any reason.Removed on: 2:50 am, February 22, 2020
Hi Aditi,This sticky is brilliant. I strongly suggest you use it to monitor.https://www.tripadvisor.com.sg/ShowTopic-g29…Whatever you decide, good luckBillEdited: 6:39 pm, February 18, 2020

As BillUK32 mentioned, the forum thread compiled by contributor minxbaby is a good source to follow up on the current status in Singapore. Other than that precautions have been taken by locals and authorities and it is safe to visit public places. Just remember to take common precautions like using hand sanitisers and washing your hands regularly. If you opt for private transport to get around, you can always check online to rent private transfers and luggage delivery here on Changi Recommends or Klook here:https://visitsingapore.changirecommends.com/https://www.klook.com/en-SG/search/…

Aditi ... just a couple of comments regarding your posts."...we will be visiting all public places with high rate of spread of infection"There actually is not a 'high rate of spread of infection.'Also," my kids like other kids that age are not gonna listen or wear a mask."By all accounts from health care professionals, wearing a mask is not a preventative measure.Of course, your concern for the health of your children is understandable. Best wishes ...

I think it is misleading to say things like "There actually is not a 'high rate of spread of infection."I think the Government is the best judge of whether the rate if infection is high enough to call it DORSCON ORANGE. Once this is lowered, then the risk will be officially reduced. This is the only view with authority to say either way. If you are looking just at the official number of cases then this alone is insufficient as a measure to determine as there may be unreported people in self quarantine at home who are infected but don't know it, and their immune system is fighting it.Estimating the Unreported Number of Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Cases...https://www.mdpi.com/2077-0383/9/2/388"The biggest breakdown yet of novel coronavirus cases suggests that 80% are mild. Some patients never show symptoms.""About 80% of novel coronavirus cases are mild, according to China’s most comprehensive report about the outbreak published so far. Many patients experience only a fever or dry cough, while some never show no symptoms."https:/…Edited: 3:55 pm, February 20, 2020
@ Prasanth, the link you have posted can be found in the pinned post at the top of the forum so there is no need to drag up old posts.

If I say “dont worry” than I will be bombarded... one of my relative caught the virus without knowing... thought was a common flu.. no fever. Was contacted by Govn staff (contact tracing) to do a swipe test... result positive and was warded... the next day was negative and so was the following day ... after that discharge... So the majority of the cases will be mild and feel like a normal flu ... what most sporean is afraid is the quarantine whether at home or at the hospital.. it disrupt ones daily life... if at home a bit better but you cant even go out to buy food... Even if you dont come to spore... you change your destination to another country.. can one guarantee that country will be free of Covid19 at that point of time... can you be sure those in the same flight with you are not infected
